Test Match Cricket: Australia v Pakistan at the SCG from Wednesday 3 to Sunday 7 January. Start of play at 10:30am daily, end of play around 5:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park, particularly on weekdays in peak travel times. Fans traveling to and from the match should allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the SCG from 6:30am Wednesday 3 January to approx. 9pm Friday 5 January.

  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP2 Kippax car park* will be maintained via Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park maintained from Lang Rd (car parks open from 7:30am daily).

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 6am (on Wednesday, Thursday & Friday) or 7am (on Saturday & Sunday) until 7pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

webLinks.linkText: Newcastle New Year's Eve 2023

properties.publicTransport:
The best way to get to and from the event is by public transport – train, light rail and ferry services. 


LIGHT RAIL

Services will run every 7.5 minutes from 4pm until midnight, and then every 15 minutes until 1am. The last service will depart Newcastle Beach at 12.45am on Monday 1 January 2024.


FERRY

Services will be extended until midnight.

The last ferry service will depart Queens Wharf at midnight.


TRAIN

  • Central Coast and Newcastle Line: An additional service will leave Newcastle Interchange at 10.32pm stopping all stations to Berowra (except Wondabyne), Hornsby, Epping, Strathfield then Central.
  • Hunter Line – from Telarah: Additional services will leave Telarah at 5.33pm, 6.31pm and 7.33pm – stopping all stations to Newcastle Interchange.
  • Hunter Line – to Telarah: Additional services will leave Newcastle Interchange at 9.29pm, 10.29pm, 11.59pm, 1.02am and 3.15am – stopping all stations to Telarah.


BUS

Bus routes 11, 13, 14 & 23 will operate to a Sunday timetable and will be diverted at Darby Street to Hunter and Scott Streets to Customs House from 6pm until the end of service.
properties.otherAdvice:
From 4pm to 9.15pm, the Queens Wharf precinct will be transformed into a vibrant carnival with rides, inflatables and amusements, roving entertainers, three DJ dancefloors, maker stations and art workshops, and a dedicated Sensory Area. Two aerobatic flyovers by Paul Bennet will be sure to turn heads to the sky, while a trio of fire dancers will dazzle audiences on the ground before a massive fireworks finale at 9pm.


Roads will be closed with diversions in place.
properties.diversions:
Hunter Street will be closed from 3pm on 31/12 until 1am on 1/1 and Scott Street will be closed from 6pm to 10pm on 31/12, with traffic controllers and signage to direct motorists.


In addition, the following local roads and carparks will be closed

  • Wharf Road (6am, 31/12 - 1am, 1/1)
  • Pacific Street and Newcomen Street (6pm - 10pm, 31/12)

The following three car parks will be closed from 4am on 30/12 and will reopen at 4pm on 2/1.

  • Wharf Road (Boat Harbour Car Park)
  • Wharf Road (Queens Wharf West Car Park)
  • Wharf Road (Queens Wharf East Car Park).

Road closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be in place this New Year's Eve in Balmain, Rozelle, Birchgrove and Drummoyne in the Balmain Peninsula.

  • From 3pm roads closures will be in place on sections of Ballast Point Rd, Brent St, Darling St, Evan St, Joseph St, Hartley St, Hanover St, Loughlin St, Mackenzie St, Mansfield St, McKell St, Mullen St, Rose St, Terry St, The Crescent, Waragal Ave, Wharf Rd and Yeend St.
  • There will be no access for general traffic from Victoria Rd into the Balmain Peninsula after 3pm. Access will be maintained for Balmain Access Permit holders on select roads with passes, buses, taxis and other authorised vehicles only. Roads will reopen from 12:30am on New Year's Day or at the direction of NSW Police when safe to do so. Traffic may be heavy exiting the area so be patient or delay your travel.
  • 8.30pm - 9.30pm and 11pm - 1.30am: Anzac Bridge citybound lanes closed - Motorists can access the city via local roads in Glebe. Iron Cove Link tunnel to Anzac Bridge and M8 entry at Victoria Rd will also be closed - Motorists will be diverted via Victoria Rd surface lanes.
  • 8.30pm – 1.30am: M8 tunnel City West Link exit – Motorists are still able to use Rozelle interchange to access Victoria Rd via the Iron Cove Link westbound exit. M4 tunnel Anzac Bridge exit – Motorists can still access City West Link via the M4 Wattle St exit.

Special event clearways are in effect on Victoria Rd from The Crescent, Rozelle to Westbourne St, Drummoyne (western side) from 3pm NYE until 2am NYD. From 1pm extended no-parking bus zones will be in effect on sections of Darling St and Grove St, and no-stopping zones will be in effect on sections of Montague St.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.﻿

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and restricted access arrangements will be in place as large crowds celebrate New Year's Eve in Rose Bay and Vaucluse.

From 3pm until 2am the following roads will close. Access for local residents will be maintained by traffic controllers until 6pm only.

  • Rose Bay: roads into Rose Bay from New South Head Rd including Bayview Hill Rd, Caledonian Rd, Collins Ave, Dumaresq Rd and Tivoli Ave. 
  • Vaucluse: roads into Vaucluse from New South Head Rd including Carrara Rd, Hopetoun Ave, Old South Head Rd, Petrarch Ave, Queens Ave, Serpentine Pde. Vaucluse Rd will be closed southbound and remain open for one-way northbound traffic only.

Roads will reopen from 2am or once crowds have cleared however motorists should expect heavy traffic leaving the area after the midnight fireworks and should travel later to avoid the peak traffic.

Motorists are reminded that access into various Eastern Suburb peninsulas will be restricted to local residents only from 3pm, in some areas access is restricted to all vehicle traffic including residents after such time.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access will be in place as large crowds celebrate New Year's Eve in Darling Point.

  • From 3pm roads into Darling Point peninsula from New South Head Road will close until 2am New Year's Day, including New Beach Rd and Loftus Rd.
  • From 6pm sections of Annandale St, Darling Point Rd, Hampden Rd, Mona Rd, Greenoaks Ave, Yarranabbe Rd and other local roads will close until 2am New Year's Day.

Motorists should expect heavy traffic leaving the area after the midnight fireworks and should travel later to avoid the peak traffic.

Motorists are reminded that access into various Eastern Suburb peninsulas will be restricted to local residents only from 3pm. Some areas access is restricted to all vehicle traffic after such time.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 8am NYE to 2am NYD on sections of New Beach Rd and Thornton St and from 3pm NYE to 2am NYD on sections of New South Head Rd at Edgecliff. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Buses are not running to McMahons Point or Milsons Point due to road closures. Buses are using temporary stops on Pacific Hwy while Blue St at North Sydney Station is closed. Ferries are not stopping at McMahons Point or Milsons Point. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
With major road closures and parking restrictions in place this New Year's Eve attendees are encouraged to leave the car at home and catch public transport instead.

Key roads in North Sydney, Milsons Point, Kirribilli, Waverton, Blues Point and Lavender Bay are closed. Roads will reopen by 3am on 1 January.

*** SYDNEY HARBOUR BRIDGE HAS REOPENED, CAHILL EXPRESSWAY REMAINS CLOSED ** Harbour Tunnel remains open.

Key road closure timings:

  • *CLOSED* 7pm 30 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: roads around vantage points in Milsons Point, Kirribilli and McMahons Point are closed including Olympic Dr, Broughton St and Henry Lawson Ave.
  • *CLOSED* 6am 31 Dec – 4am 1 Jan: the Cahill Expressway is closed in both directions. Use the Sydney Harbour Bridge or Tunnel instead for travel to and from the east. Note Harbour Bridge will close from 11pm-1.30am for the midnight fireworks.
  • *CLOSED* 8am 31 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: sections of Blues Point Rd, Alfred St and surrounding local roads are closed. 
  • *CLOSED* 3pm 31 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: Blue St at North Sydney Station.
  • *CLOSED* 5pm 31 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: major closures in North Sydney and surrounds including Alfred St South, Lavender St, Blues Point Rd, Bay Rd, Union St, Woolcott St, Miller St, Pacific Hwy southbound and surrounding local roads in Milsons Point, Lavender Bay, Waverton and Kirribilli closed
  • *CLOSED* 8pm 31 Dec - 3am 1 Jan: Pacific Hwy off-ramp to North Sydney from the Sydney Harbour Bridge closed. Use the Miller St or Military Rd off-ramps instead for access to North Sydney.

Special event clearways are in effect on various roads in Kirribilli, Lavender Bay, McMahons Point, Milsons Point and North Sydney between 1pm NYE and 3am NYD. On some streets clearways in Milsons Point, Kirribilli and McMahons Point are in effect since 7pm 30 Dec.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Transport services are resuming regular service after major roads reopen in the CBD after NYE. Most transport services are operating a 24 hour timetable.
properties.otherAdvice:
All major roads have reopened after New Year's Eve celebrations in the city and Pyrmont. Special event clearway parking restrictions are no longer in effect across most roads.

Roads still closed:

  • Cahill Expressway over the Harbour Bridge and Circular Quay
  • Macquarie St north of Bridge St and Albert St between Phillip and Macquarie St remains closed until 6am.
  • Clearways remain in effect on these roads until 6am.

webLinks.linkText: Market Street NYE Block Party

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Illawarra Hotel NYE Block will take place on 31 December.

Motorists should detour via adjacent streets and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: NYE at Parramatta Park

properties.publicTransport: Trains and buses run regularly to Parramatta within walking distance of the park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to ring in the New Year at the NYE event in Parramatta Park from 5pm - 9.30pm. Entry is free and no tickets are required.

There will be no parking inside the Park and a number of external parking spaces around the Park will not be available due to event operations.

Road closures may be implemented at the direction of NSW Police for the safety of crowds arriving and leaving the park.

Motorists should expect some delays throughout Parramatta CBD and surrounding Parramatta Park, motorists should also exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

On-street parking will be removed from:

  • Park Ave between Queens Rd and Railway Parade from 6am (Park side of road)
  • Railway Parade between Park Ave and Westmead Station from 6am (Westmead Station side of road)
  • Pitt St between Macquarie St and Park Avenue (Park side of road) from 6am.

The Parramatta River cycle way between O’Connell Street Bridge and the Parramatta Park weir will be closed from 6am on event day.

webLinks.linkText: United Cup Tennis

properties.publicTransport: Tickets include travel on trains, metro and light rail. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
United Cup Sydney at Ken Rosewall Arena at Sydney Olympic Park from Saturday 30 December to Monday 7 January.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park, particularly during peak travel times. Allow extra travel time on roads including the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Dr and Concord Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

webLinks.linkText: Field Day 2024

properties.publicTransport: Some buses will divert and miss stops while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Field Day music festival from midday until 11pm.

With thousands of people expected, traffic will be heavier than usual within the Sydney CBD. Allow extra travel time on roads including Macquarie St, College St and William St, and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

Some roads around The Domain will close for crowd safety before, during and after the event.

  • Art Gallery Rd will be closed to incoming traffic from 7pm.
  • Sections of Macquarie St, College St, Cathedral St, Art Gallery Rd, Hospital Rd, Prince Albert Rd, St Mary’s Rd and St James Rd will be closed from 9:10pm.

Parking in the area is limited and expected to reach capacity early. A dedicated drop-off zone will be located on Hospital Rd at Art Gallery Rd.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time and watch out for pedestrians in the area.

arrangementElements.html:

  • Hospital Rd from Art Gallery Rd to Shakespeare Pl
  • Macquarie St from Hunter St to Prince Albert Rd
  • St James Rd from Elizabeth St to Macquarie St
  • College St from Park St to Prince Albert Rd
  • Cathedral St at St Marys Rd

webLinks.linkText: NSW National Parks & Wildlife Service - Royal National Park local alerts

properties.otherAdvice:
The Royal National Park is expected to be busy over the Christmas and New year holiday period between 23 December and 15 January.

Road closures will be implemented as precincts and car parks reach full at Wattamolla Beach, Audley, Maianbar, and Bundeena.

If parking capacity is reached across all precincts, traffic will only be permitted to travel through the park. If there are significant delays, both the northern and southern entries to the park, via Farnell Ave at Loftus and via Lady Wakehurst Dr at Otford, will close. Entry will be maintained via McKell Ave at Waterfall for residents only. 

Visitors are encouraged to check the Royal National Park local alerts before travelling for updates on precinct access. Walking trails may also be closed due to fire bans and/or risks so plan ahead. 

Road closures when precincts reach capacity:

  • Wattamolla Rd between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Wattamolla Beach
  • Maianbar Rd between Bundeena Dr and Maianbar township
  • Bundeena Dr between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Bundeena township

Traffic controllers and NSW Police will be managing access for local residents, upon proof of address, at Maianbar Rd and Bundeena Dr

Garie Rd is closed from Sir Bertram Stevens Dr

roads.mainStreet: McKell Ave, Farnell Ave and various roads

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Macarthur FC at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, full time around 6:55pm.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to visit Taronga Zoo during the holiday period between 23 December and 1 January. Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching the Zoo including Military Rd.

  • Stop/slow traffic conditions will be in place between 9am and 3pm on Bradleys Head Rd to manage vehicle access and traffic flow to and from the Zoo car park.
  • When the Zoo car park reaches capacity there will be no general vehicle access on Bradleys Head Rd from Whiting Beach Rd.
  • Access will be maintained for buses and ferry wharf passengers as well as patrons of the Athol Hall Function Centre and the Sydney Harbour National Park.

Motorists should follow the directions of traffic controllers on site and allow plenty of extra time.
